subject: Sales
title: Pitching When You're Not the Expert
description: A quick win: understand Pitching When You're Not the Expert.

hook.text: A rep pitches a technical product they barely understand. The engineer in the room knows immediately.

buildup.text: Not every seller masters every product detail. But credibility still needs to be earned somehow.

discovery.text: Sell the outcome, not the mechanism. You don't explain how an engine works to sell the car.

twist.text: Faking expertise collapses the moment someone asks a deep technical question you can't answer.

climax.text: Say 'I'll bring our specialist for that detail' with confidence. Knowing your limits builds trust.

punchline.text: Admit what you don't know. Bring someone who does.

quiz.question: What should you do when asked a technical question you can't answer?
options: Confidently offer to bring a specialist who can answer
